description:
Who We Are

Walnut is a fast growing startup in the sales automation space, backed by top-notch investors.

We help some of the best sales teams in the world to dramatically perform better, by easily creating failure-free, interactive, and personalized demo experiences for each prospect - without coding.

We are a young company that values culture, transparency, and achievements, and put our founding members at the very heart of our company.
You will join the energetic team at Walnut TLV and will become a focal point to all admin needs. We are growing rapidly and need someone who is detail-oriented, communicative, and cares about others. You will have the opportunity to put your creativity and operational skills into action and grow with us. A can-do attitude is a must.

This is an exciting opportunity to join the most promising startup in Israel and make a true impact.

You will be working from our TLV office and support our global employees needs.

What your day to day will look like:
Welcome visitors and provide support and direction to guests, candidates, etc.
Own full employees life cycle, from on-boarding new hires to off-boarding
Focal point for IT and supporting all technical issues
Support HR & Finance tasks including payroll and legal requirements relate to local regulations
Solely responsible for the day-to-day of TLV office and facilities management, including: monitor cleaning, maintenance, ordering refreshment and office supplies
Managing the CEO calendar
Manage office budget and expenses: money wiring, receipts handling, etc.
Manage inventory, ordering, and stocking of office and kitchen supplies.
Manage vendor relationships. Conduct research and vendor searches as needed.
Coordinate meetings, business travel, and schedules
Assist in executing team social & wellness activities: happy hours, holidays, events, and more.
Perform other administrative duties and special projects as required.

Requirements:

Proven experience in a similar role for 2+ years in a global company
High level of English - a must
Energetic and proactive with a strong can-do approach
Highly organized and detailed oriented, strong multi tasking abilities
Results-driven, with excellent prioritization of workload and deadlines
Flexible, cooperative, and a team player who loves to help others
Has the ability to communicate well with all levels (internal and external)

In the News:

The 5 Next Billion-Dollar Start-Ups of 2023

4 Tech CEOs Building Iconic Brands

LinkedIn Top Startups 2022: The 15 Israeli Companies on the Rise

You better believe it! We raised $35 million in our Round B!

Tech Crunch: Walnut Growing 700% in 4 months!

World Financial Review: Walnut Raises #35 million

Ted Talk: How Walnut is Reshaping the Greater B2B Sales ExperienceShow more Report

As the world changes, join a company leading the way! Financial markets are growing ever more global and more complex. At Deloitte, we have innovated the audit by leveraging cutting-edge technology like data analytics, combined with transformative processes, that evolve our audit and assurance capabilities to meet the dynamic needs of the capital markets. As an Audit & Assurance professional, you have the opportunity to help enhance audit quality, provide deep insights, and deliver a differentiated audit!

As a full-time audit professional, you'll deliver audit services to our US clients and work cross-functionally with US and Israel Audit team members to design and execute audit procedures based on the client’s business needs, internal controls, and risks. Required: *Bachelor's degree in Accounting or related field (e.g. Business, Finance, Economics). *Experience needed or IL CPA preferred *Fluency in English; Demonstrate effective verbal and written communication skills.


The interview will be held in English *Ability to work effectively in a virtual environment. Preferred: *Work experience with a regional or international accounting firm. *Understanding of broad business & technical (US GAAP) knowledge. Location: Tel Aviv, Beit-Shemesh, Jerusalem, Haifa, Nazareth.
Flexible hours and hybrid/remote options. *The position is intended for both women and men. * We at Deloitte believe that diversity and inclusion among our people is a critical component of our success and that is why we cultivate an organizational culture that contains and embraces diversity in all its forms.

Show more Report

Join the world of banking

Every day, corporations worldwide come to Barclays for our banking expertise. We help drive global commerce by providing comprehensive financial, advisory and capital-raising services. Our bankers advise on everything from mergers and acquisitions and privatisations to debt and equity financings and restructuring. Want in? Join us as an analyst.
The chance to make an impact

After several weeks of intensive training to start, you’ll join one of our industry, product or geographic groups and start working on live deals and business development projects right away. Within small deal teams, you’ll quickly play an important role on a variety of demanding assignments. You may work on:

financial analysis and modeling
valuation
industry research
business evaluation and strategic assessment
business and idea generation
external and internal stakeholder communication.

A place where you can thrive
At Barclays, you’ll be surrounded by people who will help you achieve your ambitions. Our collaborative, supportive environment gives you the chance to build solid relationships with senior leaders, peers and clients alike. What’s more, dedicated programme managers will support and advocate for you throughout the first several years of your career at Barclays, ensuring you develop the skills you need to succeed.
During your analyst years, you’ll also:

participate in formal and informal training designed to give you the knowledge you need when you need it
receive detailed performance coaching and feedback
have opportunities to expand your network and develop leadership skills.

Your role as a Banking analyst will provide you with the skills and experience needed for a successful career in the world of finance. We’ll also provide you a visible path to the necessary steps for promotion to associate and the tools to get you there.

To be considered for this programme, you must:
be motivated with a strong degree or expected degree – in any area.

Ideally you would have:
a strong interest in business and finance, though no specific subject degree is required
a candidate with course experience in accounting (strongly recommended)
someone who shows resourcefulness, team-orientation, enthusiasm and an entrepreneurial spirit, demonstrated through participation in extracurricular activities.

It is the policy of Barclays to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law.Show more Report

Location
Training Hub Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands
Location After Training: Tel-Aviv, Israel
Start date: 31st July 2023
What You’ll Do:
Cisco Sales Associates Program (CSAP) offers a global environment that provides structured training and on-the-job-experience. We will develop your sales, technical and communication skills and you will be offered the opportunity to rotate and understand diverse areas of Sales via our model of Education Exposure Experience. You will learn how to position Cisco’s architectures, solutions and products to our customers.
Your career will continue as a Virtual Account Manager (VAM) role as part of Cisco’s Global Virtual Sales (GVS) Team. The GVS organization is passionate about driving sales productivity breakthrough and building compelling business value for our partners while nurturing our partner relationships. As a VAM, you’ll build positive relationships with existing customers and partners, working closely with them to understand their business strategy and uncover new business opportunities, whilst achieving their desired business outcomes. You’ll partner with Sales Engineers and together you’ll position the benefits of our Cisco solutions to your customer, using our best-in-class collaboration tools.
From there, your career can develop and grow into a variety of sales opportunities at Cisco.
While challenging, it will push you to become the best version of yourself. You will achieve industry-standard certifications, as part of our perpetual learning approach, and be assessed and mentored through customer simulations and on-the-job activities. We’ll offer you a safe and fun environment to practice what you’ve learnt, all the while providing you with feedback to develop your potential.
Who You'll Work With:
You’ll be part of CSAP, an award-winning and industry recognized early-in-career development program for top university graduates from around the world. You’ll train alongside incredibly talented individuals, like yourself, from different countries and a diverse group of backgrounds. Early on, you’ll make long-lasting friendships and belong to a rich human network that will support you throughout your career.
As a successful Associate Sales Representative (ASR), you’ll learn to discover, build and drive new opportunities to our customers, with our Cisco partners, while collaborating with Cisco engineers to provide technical solutions that drive business outcomes for our customers.
You’ll learn from top authorities and coaches in an unrivalled setting using our own leading-edge technology. You’ll have your own mentor, a CSAP alumnus who’s been in your shoes and will help guide you in your first year. With a strong Cisco team committed to your success, you’ll gain hands-on education and experience, while receiving an attractive salary and pursuing your career dreams!
What we offer
At Cisco, we strongly believe in the wellbeing of our employees and work life balance, and our benefits package is designed to reflect this. On top of your remuneration package and 25 days annual leave, you may be entitled to receive these Benefits & Perks as part of our People Deal and benefits package. (May vary location.)
Who You Are:
Recent graduate or on your final year of studies towards a degree or related program or other academic certification, ideally in any of: Business and Management, Finance, Marketing, Entrepreneurship, MIS, Engineering or other related degrees.Fluent in English and HebrewWilling to relocate for 12 months to a designated CSAP training hub as required. Immigration and relocation support will be provided should the program be delivered in training hubs as opposed to virtually.Technology enthusiast who enjoys innovatingDemonstrate an eagerness to establish a long-term Sales career with Cisco UKIApproach situations with an open and curious mind, taking on challenges with an eye for opportunity.Ability to take complex problems, simplify them and thinking creatively to solve them.A strong communicator with the confidence to engage and talk to a wide range of people and who and views team collaboration as instrumental to achieving success.
Why Cisco
Cisco is an Equal Opportunity Employer and you will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, or any other legally protected basis.
#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses.
But "Digital Transformation" is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!
Cisco are always looking to identify talented people. If you are reading this posting then we may not have an open job right now, however it is highly likely we will in the future. If you are interested in working for Cisco in this capacity then please submit your details and CV or resume against this requisition so that when a suitable vacancy arises a Cisco representative can contact you directly.
Please note that vacancies will be filled on a rolling basis after opening and we will close applications as offers are accepted; possibly before the stated deadline. Therefore, we highly recommend you submit your application as early as possible in order to be considered for the opportunity of your choice
Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S.:

When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire salaries in U.S. locations. For non-sales roles, the hiring ranges reflect base salary and do not include bonuses, equity, or benefits. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive target, and do not include equity or benefits. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.Show more Report

Tel Aviv, IL | Facilities & IT | Full-time
Not your everyday company
Lemonade completely reinvented how insurance works. As a customer-centric tech company, we created an insurance experience that is smart, instant, and delightful.
At Lemonade, you’ll be working with a group of like-minded makers, who get a kick out of moving fast and delivering great products. We surround ourselves with some of the smartest, most motivated, creative people who are filled with positive energy and good karma.
Unlike most publicly traded companies, we’re nimble and efficient. We take pride in the fact that we still think and operate like a startup. We don’t care much about titles and hierarchy and instead focus on innovation, bold moves, and challenging the status quo.
We’re built as a lean, data-driven organization that relies on a common understating of objectives and goals to provide teams with autonomy and ownership. We don’t like spending our days in meetings and we skip committees altogether. At Lemonade, there’s no such thing as going over someone’s head. We have zero tolerance for bureaucracy, office politics, and lean-back personalities.
As a Public Benefit Corporation and a certified B-Corp, we deliver environmental and social impact using our products and tech. Through our Giveback program, we partner with organizations such as the ACLU, New Story, The Humane Society, Malala Fund, American Red Cross, 360.org, charity: water, and dozens of others, and have donated millions towards reforestation, education, animal rights, LGBTQ+ causes, access to water, and more.
Awarded ‘best workplace’
Best Workplace and Best-Led Company by Inc. Magazine
High 4.4 rating on Glassdoor ️
Our Founders listed among Glassdoor’s Top CEOs
“World Changing” by Fast Company
Recognized as a World Changing Idea by Fast Company Magazine
Ranked #1 Home insurance in America
Won best renters and homeowners insurance in America by US News, and others
Best Pet Insurance in America
Rated “Best Overall Pet Insurance” by Better Homes & Gardens
Rated 4.9 on the Apple App Store
Among the highest rated apps of all time
What you’re applying for
Lemonade is looking for a big hearted Office Operations Lead to manage our Office Ops team and oversee our vibrant and growing TLV site. This people person should be detail oriented, customer-obsessed, and ready to lead the team who manages ongoing daily operations and logistics, facilities, events planning, and office life for our +300 TLV Makers. This role collaborates closely with other teams to manage processes with a broader impact on our employees’ experience to ensure we provide a best in-class, delightful, and unique workplace experience for our Lemonade Makers.

We’re looking for a person who shines in the role of a “generalist”, is resourceful and creative, and has great project management skills. In this position you will manage the local Office Operations team while working closely with managers and leadership across the organization, and also with external parties.

We’re looking for an Office Operations Lead who has a passion for high quality delivery of everything employee-experience related, and can ensure new employees have a positive employee lifecycle (soft landing, anniversaries, termination, etc.). In your day-to-day, you would be expected to plan and execute large-scale company-wide initiatives, which means you’ll drive strategy, work with internal and external stakeholders, build budgets, communicate and execute plans, and collect feedback and share recommendations with leadership. You’ll also do everything from picking the perfect color temperature of a light bulb, to organizing holiday toasts and ‘extracurricular’ activities, to negotiating the best deals for the employees’ benefits, and making sure everything runs smoothly and with ease.

You’ll work closely with many stakeholders - both managers and leadership from different teams: People Operations, IT, Finance, Legal, Talent Acquisition, and other support functions. You’ll identify problems, build communication plans, lead and execute projects, and do that whilst being legally compliant, creative, on schedule, on budget, and with a drop of humor.

You will manage our TLV Office Operations team and oversee the employee experiences. You will liaise between administration, facilities, office life, and events to ensure we provide our employees with the best working experience possible.
In this role you’ll
Oversee all office operations projects and processes
Manage the local Office Operations team
Partner with different support functions such as People Ops, Finance, Legal, IT and Talent Acquisition to create a delightful, compliant and unique employee experience
Create, implement and monitor company and site policies
What you’ll need
+8 years of operations and managerial experience
Experience in hyper-growth organizations with +300 employees
An extraordinary communicator, with fantastic verbal and written communication skills
To know a bit in many employee experience related fields
Learn new things quickly and independently
Endless creativity and a “can solve any problem” attitude
An execution state of mind, with no hesitation to take on hands-on work and drive the team to deliver faster
Superior attention to details (while keeping seeing the big picture) and an enthusiasm for delighting employees
Great English
Ability to remain organized while adapting in a dynamic environment
Exceptional EQ - natural ability to ‘read’ and influence people
Great project management skills
Passion to create a “best in class” workplace environment
Things to know…
Lemonade is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusivity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you require reasonable accommodations due to religious beliefs, pregnancy, or disabilities, let us know at any time.Show more Report

company: ธนาคารไทยพาณิชย์
description:
สมัครโปรดคลิกที่ปุ่ม "Apply"
If you are an active SCB employee, please apply through Workday by searching "Find Jobs".
If this is your first time applying you will need to create a candidate account when you click on apply.
Job Description
Perform Due Diligence on Venture Capital Investment
Gather information from target company and industry experts
Do research on the existing references and customers of the target company
Explore and research potential competitors to the target company
Work closely with technical/business consultants to evaluate the target company including IPs
Conduct background checks on the current management of the target company
Develop financial modelling and valuation analysis and prepare internal investment memo
Perform market research to help identify new investment trends and opportunities
Manage deal screening; call and/or meet with prospects, evaluate opportunities
Summarize documentation; call notes, enter deals into CRM
Connect business network with peers in other Venture Capital Firms
Perform monitoring and reporting of portfolio companies
Qualification:
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Business, Finance, Engineering, Accounting discipline preferred
At least 5 years’ experience in Venture Capital or related field
Experience in Investment experience and/or due diligence
Understand both technical and business concepts quickly and effectively with business acumen
We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us.Show more Report

Date: Jan 31, 2023
Location:
Israel, Petach Tikva
Job Category: Finance
Department: Corporate Functions (HR, Finance, Legal)
Who we are:
CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR), the global leader in Identity Security, Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity – human or machine – across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world’s leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets

What will you do:
Full ownership of travel policy including updates, common and best practices and follow-up with travelers.
Gather, produce, and analyze global travel data. Communication of relevant data to management via periodic reports.
Various Travel tools administrator such as Global booking tool, global expense reimbursement tool, travel credit cards etc.
Provide Support, training and guidance for employees to all travel systems, processes and policies.
Travel coordinator and support for company special events and gatherings.
Address for employees with all travel and booking related issues.
Point of contact for travel systems vendors – enhancement requests tracking, system improvements initiatives, real time problem solving for employees.
Level of service global coordinator.
Manage relationships and build partnerships to ensure corporate travelers receive exceptional customer service and secure best rates.
Global insurance, visa and travel documents admin for employees.
Ensure and establish travel efficiency by utilizing special bonus plans, points and loyalty plans (credit cards, airlines, and hotels).
Track and approve overseas gatherings to align to approved budget.
Support procurement with Ad hock travel related assignments.

What you need to succeed:
Minimum 4 years experience as a travel manager, preferably from a high-tech company
Travel industry expert with proven knowledge of best practices
Fluent English (written and verbal)
Proven experience in setting up and managing corporate travel platforms such us Expensify, Egencia, Trip Actions, and similar tools
Interpersonal and customer service skills
Proactive and able to take initiative.
Strong attention to detail and ability to identify and resolve issues quickly and effectively.
Good organizational, management and negotiation skills

To learn more about CyberArk, visit https://www.cyberark.com, read the CyberArk blogs or follow on Twitter via @CyberArk, LinkedIn or Facebook.
#LI-OC1Show more Report

We are looking for a sharp and highly analytical Product Analyst to join our fast-growing company and help us make data-driven decisions for performance optimization.
As a Product Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping Elementor's product and business strategy, defining our KPIs, and identifying business opportunities.
As a member of the Analytics team in our Data department, you will work across the organization and provide key insights to multiple departments (Marketing, Product, Finance, Business Strategy, CX, and more), helping them focus on what’s important.
This position is located in Israel only.
Requirements:

4+ years of experience in quantitative analysis, preferably at an internet company
Excellent communication skills with the ability to deliver results of analyses clearly and effectively
Excellent SQL skills - a must
Experience with at least one of the following visualization tools: QlikView, Qlik Sense, Power BI, Tableau - a must
Strong Python capabilities - a major advantage
Experience working with big data tools: Redshift, BigQuery, Databricks, etc. - a must
A highly independent and creative team player who works well with others
Hands-on technical experience with Google Analytics, Google Ads, and Facebook Ads - an advantage
Work Environment:

What do we do?
Elementor is the leading website building platform for WordPress professionals.
Our vision is to empower web creators - developers, designers, and marketers, with the ability to create their futures one pixel at a time. We provide our users with everything they need to become successful web creators.
A new website is created every 10 seconds using Elementor!
Since we launched in Israel in 2016, we have expanded to more than 150 countries, with more than 12M websites powered by Elementor. More than 8% of all websites around the world are built using Elementor!
How do we do it?
At Elementor, we're building the future of web creation.
We believe in empowering both our employees and our users.
Elementor is a place where you can truly grow professionally and personally.
Creativity, friendship, curiosity, motivation, and professionalism are the driving force behind our journey. We take great pride in Elementor's constant scaling.
Responsibilities:

Work with various managers to learn their business insight needs, including tracking metrics, dashboards, and reports
Act as a bridge between units’ business needs and the BI department, ensuring high-quality execution quality, data integrity of analyzed insights, and reporting deliverables
Establish reporting methodologies and cross-department standards
Go beyond the numbers to communicate, influence, support, and execute business decisionsShow more Report

Responsibilities
Develop new business leads
Expand the portfolio by handling up-sales and potential new accounts, including cold calls
Manage all account-related processes and projects - from lead generation, pre to post sale, consulting, support, and back-office management
Handle an existing account portfolio to preserve the customer base
Attend industry conferences and meet-ups to represent the company, network and gather leads
Requirements
2-5 years’ experience as an account manager in a business-oriented market OR equivalent sales track record in successful B2B sales - a must
Ability to withstand tight deadlines and ambitious goals
BA degree – a must.
BA in business, finance, marketing, economics, communications, technology, or related field – an advantage.
Strong negotiation and presentation skills.
Experience working with CRM Systems and Marketing automation systems.
Excellent spoken and written skills in Hebrew and English. Other languages – an advantage.
Familiarity with technology, high-tech or investments markets - definite advantage
References will be requiredShow more Report

לחברת הייטק גדולה ומבילה דרוש/ה Senior financial Analyst Developing financial models and methodologies based on historical data and forecasting based on a variety of specific operating parameters. Introduce new models, KPIs, trends estimation and analysis Analysis, identification and gathering of data requirements for model tracking and derivation. Appropriate sensitivity and scenario analysis help assist investment decisions. Take leading part in the company’s portfolio analysis process.

Responsible for Cashflow modeling and forecast Be the focal point for complex financial modeling, providing value-added insights to management to support business decisions. Partner with the relevant Executive Management to support decision-making and provide insights. Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Economics or Finance, MBA is an advantage 6+ years of relevant experience including modeling, forecasting, and financial analysis Deep understanding of accounting concepts (Rev Rec, CF, accruals, etc.) Strong analytical skills with an emphasis on high-level Excel A high level of commitment and motivation Able to meet tight deadlines and has multitasking abilities High standards of accuracy and precision; highly organized Ability to think creatively and self-motivated Passionate about automation, efficiency and tools Strong communication and interpersonal skills Excellent analytical, decision-making, and problem-solving skillsShow more Report

Kennedys is looking for an Associate to work on corporate commercial matters.
The role involves advising local Israeli as well as non-Israeli clients in the insurance and finance industry.
Legal work is of a wide and business oriented nature, such as drafting commercial agreements, conducting legal search, researching legal matters, overseeing legal disputes, advising on the appropriate course and if advisable settlements, reviewing relevant regulations and advising on their implementations.
This is an exciting opportunity to grow, learn and develop to be well knowledgeable corporate commercial lawyer in the fields of insurance and finance.

Team

Kennedys' commercial team consists of specialist lawyers who advise on a wide range of commercial services covers a broad spectrum including corporate, employment, property, construction, insolvency, international litigation and arbitration. We support our clients with commercial contracts, data protection, cyber-security, IP/IT, e-commerce, procurement, state aid and competition.

Our Israel practice consists of a team of skilled, multilingual lawyers (including Hebrew speakers and Israeliqualified lawyers) who understand and have experience of Israeli business and culture. We aim to give rapid and practical legal advice tailored to your needs. We provide our London and international insurer clients with insurance and reinsurance coverage advice as well as monitoring, claims administration, management and coordination services relating to Israeli risks.

Clients

Local and international clients
Insurers/reinsurers

Cases

A mixed corporate and Commercial caseload.

Required experience

2+ years' qualified with the relevant experience*
Prior knowledge in the finance and insurance industry(including Fintech and Insurtech) is a major advantage
Must have English as a first language or be as proficient in this language.

About Kennedys

Kennedys is a global law firm with expertise in dispute resolution and advisory services. With over 2,300 people worldwide across 43 offices in the UK, Europe, Middle East, Asia Pacific and America we have some of the most respected legal minds in their field.

Our lawyers handle both contentious and non-contentious matters, and provide a range of specialist legal services, for many industry sectors but we have particular expertise in litigation and dispute resolution, especially in defending insurance and liability claims.

We're a fresh-thinking firm, and we're not afraid to bring challenging new perspectives to the table way beyond the traditional realm of legal services. We empower our clients with a diverse range of ideas, tools and technology to make their lives easier, as well as delivering exceptional results, every time.

What do we have to offer?

We welcome high-performing lawyers, business services professionals, secretaries, graduates and apprentices to join our rapidly expanding global firm. Whatever your role at Kennedys, you'll be involved in exciting and stimulating work, where your input will make a difference.

Our culture and values form a big part of who we are and we take them seriously. We make a difference by being approachable,straightforward, supportive and distinctive. Our values are at the core of who we are and what make us a great firm to work with and for.

We develop careers in an innovative and collaborative global environment, with our values at the core. We believe that supporting individual growth and development puts us in the best position to attract and retain talented individuals. Regardless of role or level, everyone has access to virtual learning to help you develop your skills, wherever you are in the world. A variety of other exciting opportunities are available including secondments to clients and our global offices as well as a comprehensive benefits package (details are available upon request).

We've created a culture based on client service, professional excellence, hard work and trust. We deeply value the relationships we build with our clients and we know that they value our warm, friendly human approach. We are here to provide answers, recommendations, strategy and tactics.

Kennedys is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to ensuring our recruitment processes are as inclusive as possible. We expect all employees to be aware of and comply with all relevant policies and procedures within their jurisdiction, including those relating to Information Security, Data Protection and Quality Management, refer any breach promptly to Risk & Compliance and to complete all mandatory training when requested.

*Where a level of experience is indicated, this is a guideline only and represents the amount of time we would usually expect a candidate to accumulate the requisite level of experience. This does not preclude applications from candidates with more or less experience.Show more Report

Israel · Full-time · Senior
About The Position
Are you an ‘Excelloholic’? Do you find yourself losing hours of sleep at night thinking about the design of a new financial analysis?
Do you want to design and improve processes that help drive the revolution that is changing the world of Sports? If yes, you belong with Pixellot.
Pixellot, leading the AI revolution in sports production, is looking for a dedicated Senior FP&A, to join our amazing finance team, and play a key role in supporting Pixellot's strategy & FP&A processes.
With more than 150,000 games produced and streamed live every month, Pixellot is the world’s largest producer of live sports content. The company pioneered the concept of automated sports production as an affordable alternative to traditional video capture, production, and distribution, for professional, semi-professional, and grassroots games. Pixellot produced games that are delivered both live and on demand, through a variety of distribution channels to fans, families, athletes, coaches, scouts, and sports betting organizations.
If you are passionate about joining a growing and dynamic company focused on revolutionizing Sports production and working with game-changers and out-of-the-box teammates, Lets talk!
 As part of your work you will:Be responsible for planning, analysing, and developing new KPIsTake a part in Implementation of new systems & design of new financial practices to address business needsDevelop and maintain periodically KPI reports to management and the board of directorsDevelop and maintain a sales compensation structureAssist in maintaining and updating the company's pricing strategyBe involved in analyses of the company's M&A activities
 You should bring with you:At least 5+ years’ experience in a SaaS company with annual revenue of at least $50mSelf-motivation and the ability to take initative, prioritize with minimal supervision and work independentlyStrong interest and experience in developing process improvementsAdvanced Microsoft Excel skillsExcellent communication, creative problem-solving & strong organization skills.High level of English, verbal and writtenDiscretion in working with confidential informationAttention to detailsBI SkillsShow more Report

job: Americas Delivery Center Senior Analyst- Finance and Accounting
description:
JOB REQUISITION
Americas Delivery Center Senior Analyst- Finance and Accounting
LOCATION
AMERICAS DELIVERY CENTER
ADDITIONAL LOCATION
JOB DESCRIPTION
Are You Ready to Live Protiviti?
The Protiviti Career provides opportunity to learn, inspire, and advance within a collaborative and diverse culture. We hire curious individuals for whom learning is a passion. Together, we focus on our mission of delivering confidence in a dynamic world – and the world has perhaps never been more dynamic.
At every level, we champion leaders who live our values of integrity, inclusion, innovation and commitment to success. Imagining our work as a journey, we believe integrity guides our way, inclusion moves us forward together, and innovation creates new destinations.
Living our values every day. That's Living Protiviti.
Are you inspired to make a difference?
You’ve come to the right place.
WHERE WE NEED YOU
The Protiviti Americas Delivery Center is seeking a Senior Analyst to join our growing team. Embracing Protiviti’s vision of “Bringing Confidence to a Dynamic World,” Americas Delivery Center (ADC) provides cost-effective, tech-enabled, and standardized services at scale, to drive efficiency into our service delivery processes in support of our global clients.
As part of the Protiviti ADC team, you will collaborate with a team of professionals striving to deliver service excellence for our clients around the globe. On a typical day, our delivery center staff will collaborate and execute tasks for the project assigned to them in support of Protiviti’s Solution offerings – Technology, Risk and Compliance, Internal Audit & Financial Advisory, and Business Performance Improvement. The site capabilities may include research, development, maintenance, testing, validation, reporting, and other activities based on client needs.
WHAT YOU’LL FOCUS ON
Developing an understanding of business processes, technical skills, project requirements, and the client’s business in a variety of industries.
Conducting testing of business process and IT controls, performing data migrations and data analyses and assisting in development and testing of Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) frameworks.
Ensuring timely and quality completion of assigned project phases within a defined budget.
Assisting with the preparation of client deliverables, including agendas, status reports, and final reports.
Mentoring Analysts by demonstrating the attributes of excellent client service, technical, and professional knowledge.
Reviewing Analysts’ project work for quality and accuracy and providing valuable feedback on areas of improvement.
Assisting in scheduling and project prioritization for Analysts.
Communicating findings, roadblocks, and project status to the project team management.
Identifying areas for improvement within processes or providing improvement suggestions when challenges arise.
Independently interviewing client teams to understand current state system and processes.
Fostering and maintaining meaningful client relationships.
Upon hire, you will be provided with comprehensive training sessions. Depending on your project work, day-to-day activities may include one or more of the following:
Analysis
Performing testing of internal and IT controls using pre-defined instructions/guidance within recognized frameworks (e.g., Sarbanes-Oxley, NIST CSF, etc.).
Performing support for accounting activities such as preparation and computation of financial records, reviewing invoices, preparing data for entry into systems, and evaluating transactions for accuracy.
Reporting
Preparing project status reports including outlining key accomplishments, items for discussion, and next steps.
Performing budget vs. actuals findings by comparing project hours incurred to overall project budget.
Preparing reports (summarizing work performed) including detailed findings and result dashboards.
Innovation and Learning
Identifying areas of professional interest (i.e., cybersecurity, privacy, financial crimes compliance, accounting, etc.) and completing trainings to expand knowledge in the designated area.
Supporting Innovation activities by providing internal recommendations related to improving the way in which we deliver services to clients (e.g., through Automation, increased standardization etc.)
WHAT WILL HELP YOU BE SUCCESSFUL
You learn quickly and have the flexibility to adapt to changing roles and requests.
You enjoy working in a team environment and serving as a mentor to others.
You are highly organized and have familiarity with project management concepts.
You enjoy problem solving and have the ability to bring order to unstructured problems.
You have the ability to foster relationships with colleagues and with clients.
You can leverage listening skills to determine the best course of action for our clients.
You possess excellent written communication skills (experience with business writing preferred.)
YOUR EDUCATIONAL & PROFESSIONAL CREDENTIALS
Bachelors Degree and 2+ years' experience with internal or external audit or controls testing.
Strong skills in Microsoft Office suite applications with emphasis on Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.

We are looking for a sharp and highly analytical Data Analyst to join our fast-growing company and help us make data-driven decisions for performance optimization.
As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping Elementor's product and business strategy, defining our KPIs, and identifying business opportunities.
As a member of the Analytics team in our Data department, you will work across the organization and provide key insights to multiple departments (Marketing, Product, Finance, Business Strategy, CX, and more), helping them focus on what’s important.
This position is located in Israel only.

4+ years of experience in quantitative analysis, preferably at an internet company
Excellent communication skills with the ability to deliver results of analyses clearly and effectively
Excellent SQL skills - a must
Experience with at least one of the following visualization tools: QlikView, Qlik Sense, Power BI, Tableau - a must
Strong Python capabilities - a major advantage
Experience working with big data tools: Redshift, BigQuery, Databricks, etc. - a must
A highly independent and creative team player who works well with others
Hands-on technical experience with Google Analytics, Google Ads, and Facebook Ads - an advantage
BSc/BA in a highly quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, economics, or engineering - an advantage
Work Environment:

What do we do?
Elementor is the leading website building platform for WordPress professionals.
Our vision is to empower web creators - developers, designers, and marketers, with the ability to create their futures one pixel at a time. We provide our users with everything they need to become successful web creators.
A new website is created every 10 seconds using Elementor!
Since we launched in Israel in 2016, we have expanded to more than 150 countries, with more than 12M websites powered by Elementor. More than 8% of all websites around the world are built using Elementor!
How do we do it?
At Elementor, we're building the future of web creation.
We believe in empowering both our employees and our users.
Elementor is a place where you can truly grow professionally and personally.
Creativity, friendship, curiosity, motivation, and professionalism are the driving force behind our journey. We take great pride in Elementor's constant scaling.
Responsibilities:

Work with various managers to learn their business insight needs, including tracking metrics, dashboards, and reports
Act as a bridge between units’ business needs and the BI department, ensuring high-quality execution quality, data integrity of analyzed insights, and reporting deliverables
Establish reporting methodologies and cross-department standards
Go beyond the numbers to communicate, influence, support, and execute business decisionsShow more Report

Job Summary: As a Payroll Accountant and Bookkeeper, you will join our finance team, reporting to our Director of Finance. You will handle our day-to-day financial activities, bookkeeping and accounting functions and will be in charge of the company’s end to end bookkeeping. Essential Duties and Responsibilities · Handling employee full life cycle including onboarding, termination of employees and all salary related updates. · Processing Israeli payroll, laws, and procedures.

Timely execution of tax, National Insurance and benefit related payments · Support the sales team and ongoing review of the company’s revenue cycle (invoices to customer, AR, billing) · GR’s review and reconciliation to relevant expense, review of production accounts and assistance with periodically inventory closing. · Ad hoc reports, assistance with analysis and relevant programs (incentive programs) · Bank accounts managing, monthly reconciliation and reports. · IC reconciliation, conduct periodic reconciliations of all accounts to ensure their accuracy · Overall review of the trial balance and specific accounts. · Conduct periodic reconciliations of all accounts to ensure their accuracy.


Eagerness to learn and self-motivated personality . · Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously . · Certified bookkeeper- Minimum level 2. · Experience with Multi Monetary bookkeeping and accounting systems.
Previous experience in a multinational company – A must. · Strong written and oral communication skills. High level of English (Both written and Oral) – A must. · Ability to work independently in accordance with established policies and regulations.
Strong Microsoft Excel including formula integration (sumif, vlookup etc.).

Who are we?
Papaya Global is an established B2B tech unicorn in hypergrowth. We are on a mission to reimagine the payroll category with a game-changing, disruptive technology.
Papaya Global is reinventing workforce management, global payroll and payroll payments to remove the friction of complexity and regulation create. Our automated platform helps companies hire, onboard, manage, and pay people in more than 160 countries.
We don’t just cover the globe with our solution; we are global. We are comprised of people from different countries, different cultures, and different backgrounds. Diversity is our secret weapon.
We are looking for a Payroll Operations Group Lead to join our team. We work closely with fast-growing companies worldwide, managing their global payroll through our SaaS platform. We are looking for a candidate with a passion for details, timelines, and global operations.

Manage the Global Operations team to ensure that goals and tasks are achieved and completed in the required timeline.
 Improve existing work processes to achieve better efficiency and scalability
Learn a lot about global payroll calculation and be exposed to a wide variety of payment systems and suppliers.
Resolve payroll discrepancies

Build trusted relationships with Papaya's suppliers for future growth and commitment
Ensure teamwork responsibilities and a commitment to meeting timelines and quality

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, and/or Economics
Experience managing complex finance operation teams and past experience with managing managers.
Strong teamwork-leading skills, ability to adapt to a fast-paced, international work environment with a passion for making an impact
Fluent English and excellent communications skills. Additional languages are an advantage.
Experience with business reporting and analytics
Experience with payroll reporting is an advantage.
Proficient in Excel (Pivot & Vlookup)Show more Report

At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives.
Job Description Summary: What you need to know about the role- Decision scientists are highly motivated team players with strong analytical skills who specialize in creating, driving and executing initiatives to mitigate fraud on PayPal’s platform and improve the experience for PayPal’s hundreds of millions of customers, while guaranteeing compliance with regulations. Meet our team Decision scientists in the Digital Identity and Authentication team are problem solvers suited to approach varied challenges in complex big data environments. As part of our day-to-day job, we are collaborating with a wide variety of partners in the company, such as product experts, data scientists and engineers to bring our analytical insights to life, impacting the experience and security of millions of users around the globe.
Job Description:
Your way to impact
Decision scientists deeply understand PayPal’s business objectives, as their impact on PayPal’s top and bottom lines is immense. As a Lead Decision Scientist, you will analyse key performance indicators and track financial and operational metrics with the aim of adapting PayPal’s advanced proprietary fraud prevention and experience mechanisms and enabling growth.
Your day to day
In your role as a Lead Decision Scientist, you will:
Develop and own data-driven risk decision strategies to support PayPal’s global financial business goals
Plan and execute long-term projects from start to finish
Drive end-to-end processes with partners across many organizations
Work with product and platform teams to develop cutting edge, scalable and safe products, to enhance the experience for our global customers
Utilize bottom-up, story based, innovative techniques to apply analytical know how onto PayPal’s risk strategies
Measure performance against KPIs and goals
Maintain ongoing communication with stakeholders and peers across the company and share updates with senior leaders in a clear manner
What do you need to bring-
Bachelor’s Degree or above in one of the following: economics, finance, engineering, exact sciences, etc. (MBA – an advantage)
5+ years of work experience in relevant positions (e.g. Decision scientist, data analyst, statistician, data scientist, FP&A, product/process manager, risk management, army intelligence units)
Proven analytical skills
Technical orientation; Experience in SQL / R / Python / other programming language – a must
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills
Quick-thinker, fast learner, wide general knowledge, problem solver
**We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don't hesitate to apply.
Our Benefits:
At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com

Who We Are:
To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx

PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution for more than 20 years. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, the PayPal platform is empowering more than 400 million consumers and merchants in more than 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy. Description

Deloitte Israel is looking for a business corporate controller to join our finance team.

The successful candidate will lead the controllership team, will be involved in all the financial processing, and manage all aspects of the finance department’s daily operations.

Deloitte Israel has been an integral part of the US firm since 2019 when the US-Israel member firms combination agreement was executed. The Finance team is managed on a single platform and the continuation of the finance transformation is supported through integration with state-of-the-art technology systems and processes.

The position is open to both women and men

The job is full-time and hybrid in Azrieli Towers, Tel Aviv/from home

Responsibilities:

Manage the controllership team in Israel and collaborate with US and global finance teams across the organization
Drive the consolidated periodic financial statement close process, implement controls, monitor changes, oversee the close execution with global teams.
Responsible for all accounting issues, operations and activities, guide controllers, implement new processes and improve existing analysis and controls.
Oversee and review the financial data, AR, collection, AP, GL maintenance, Capex, reconciliations, allocation, FX gain/loss ect…
Manage day to day analyses and management reporting, ensure proper internal controls
Develop relationships with global teams
Requirements

Requirements:

CPA (BIG 4), BA in Accounting, MBA (is a plus)
10+ years experience as a controller
Must have strong accounting knowledge and strong business perspective.
Proven experience as a controller in global company
Problem solving skills
Strong management capabilities and proactive leader
Team player – excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, English and Hebrew
Experience working with SAP is an advantage
Reporting to the VP Finance

At Deloitte, we believe that an inclusive mindset and diverse workforce are two of our greatest competitive strengths. That’s why we continue to reinforce our commitment to foster inclusionShow more Report

Data Protection Compliance Manager
Background
At Immunai, we’re on a mission to revolutionize the way we treat immune diseases. We believe that by harnessing the power of immunomics and machine learning, we can unlock the key to developing the next generation of immunomodulatory drugs.
Our team, comprised of immunologists, engineers, drug developers, computer scientists, and entrepreneurs, uses cutting-edge technology like single-cell multiomics and functional genomics to map the human immune system like never before. We’re delving deep into its inner workings and uncovering novel insights into immune disease pathology.
With the use of neural networks and transfer learning, we’re sifting through a massive immune database and deciphering the mechanisms of action and resistance of existing drugs. This information is helping us identify and validate new immune targets and target combinations and supports the development of improved therapeutics.
Our ultimate goal is to bring breakthrough medicines to patients as quickly and successfully as possible. With our engineering-first approach, we’re confident we can make it happen. Together, we’re shaping the future of immune disease treatment.
Location – Tel Aviv (Hybrid)
For details - www.immunai.com, shlomit@immunai.com
Responsibilities
We seek an exceptionally motivated individual to join our talented team in a highly collaborative startup environment at the intersection of immunology, AI, and new genomic technologies.
This role's responsibilities are:
Create the company’s Data Protection and Privacy policies and procedures in compliance with ISO27001, GDPR, and customers' requirements. Examples of required policies are Privacy policies, Supplier management, Tools management, Access and permissions management, Data classification, DR plan, BCP Plan, Risk management, etc.
Work with IT, Legal, HR, Finance, RD, DevOps, Product, and Project teams to design and create relevant work instructions to comply with the relevant Data Protection and Privacy policies.
Assess the company’s information systems regularly to ensure proper data protection
Classify the company’s data and enforce relevant protection mechanisms per classification
Facilitate relevant data protection activities on a regular basis across all relevant company teams
Facilitate formal ISO audits
Requirements:

Requirements:
1+ years experience with Information security standards and procedures
Dealing with ISO27001 standard
Good ability to read, understand and interpret ISO27001 requirements, GDPR requirements, and customer contracts.
Excellent interpersonal capabilities, ability to interact with all company functions, set and facilitate meetings, derive action items, and pursue progress from all relevant stakeholders.
Basic ability to learn and understand basic IT systems and security configuration
Excellent ability to generate procedures/SOPs documentation in English while using the expected level of verbiage (similar to SOPs verbiage).
Excellent ability to generate simple checklists work instructions and forms that translate formal procedures into day-to-day working documents.
Strong analytical skills, problem-solving ability, attention to detail, and innovation atitude
Be very organized, process-oriented, and accurate (for executing and maintaining the activities that will be defined as part of this new procedure)
Familiarity with life sciences is an advantage
Desired Personal traits
You want to make an impact on humankind
You prioritize “We” over “I”
You enjoy getting things done - with super high quality
You collaborate effectively with people of diverse backgrounds and cultures
You have superior skills and experience, and constantly strive to be world-class in what you do
You constantly challenge your own assumptions, pushing for continuous improvement
You have a growth mindset
You take pride in owning crucial tasks and successfully executing them
No problem is not your problem
You make decisions that favor the company, not yourself or your teamShow more Report

Advise sales management on distributed sales customer information, market trends, and Edwards' historical sales data for development of strategies to achieve business development goals. Ensure validity of all distributed sales transactions and pricing.

Be the primary contact with Israeli cardiac surgeons and hospital staff to ensure sales and promotion of the Surgical portfolio in collaboration with local distributor.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead in analyzing customer pricing data, and developing and updating customer pricing data reports for provision to Distributors, in keeping with Distributor agreement
Analyze Distributor chargeback/rebate claims; negotiate and provide solutions to resolve discrepancies with Distributors
Lead in analyzing Distribution sales trends, develop findings, and propose solutions for sales management
Resolve complex Distributor issues and propose solutions to achieve desired sales results
Assess and prioritize Distributor AR account issues in collaboration with Finance to allocate resources to address discrepancies
Confirm accuracy of sales tracings and Distributor sales shipments
Works independently on complex projects and/or lines of work

Additional Skills:

Proven expertise in MS Office Suite including Word, PowerPoint, Access, and Excel; Qlik experience preferred
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal relationship skills including consultative and relationship management skills
Ability to quantify abstract conceptual data into concrete analysis
Adhere to all company rules and requirements (e.g., pandemic protocols, Environmental Health & Safety rules) and take adequate control measures in preventing injuries to themselves and others as well as to the protection of environment and prevention of pollution under their span of influence/control
Experience with distribution contracts preferred

About Edwards Lifesciences

Edwards Lifesciences is the global leader in patient-focused medical innovations for structural heart disease, as well as critical care and surgical monitoring. Driven by a passion to help patients, the company collaborates with the world’s leading clinicians and researchers to address unmet healthcare needs, working to improve patient outcomes and enhance lives. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Edwards Lifesciences has extensive operations in North America, Europe, Japan, Latin America and Asia and currently employs over 13,000 individuals worldwide.

For us, helping patients is not a slogan - it’s our life’s work. From developing devices that replace or repair a diseased heart valve to creating new technologies that monitor vital signs in the critical care setting, we focus on helping patients regain and improve the quality of their life.

COVID Vaccination Requirement

Edwards is committed to complying with the requirements and guidance from our government authorities and to protecting our vulnerable patients and the healthcare providers who are treating them around the world. As such, all Healthcare Interacting positions require COVID-19 vaccination, which includes anyone who directly interfaces with patients and those who interact with healthcare providers as part of their role. If hired, as a condition of employment, you will be required to submit proof that you have been fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless you request and are granted a medical or religious accommodation for exemption from the vaccination requirement. This vaccination requirement does not apply in countries where it is prohibited by law to impose vaccination. In countries where vaccines are less available, or other requirements exist, we may institute alternate measures that optimize patient safety and healthcare provider safety, which may include regular COVID testing or specific masking requirements.

For United States Applicants Only:
Edwards is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer including protected Veterans and individuals with disabilities.

job: Financial Planning and Analysis Manager - Israel & Gulf/Levant
description:
Job Description
Our Finance team brings together our financial perspectives into our overall strategic and tactical decision making. We use state-of-the-art techniques for financial analysis, planning, accounting, reporting and performance evaluation. This allows the organization to continue advancing medical innovation and improve lives.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Providing financial analysis and guidance to commercial leads and business units to ensure a maximum return on investment.
Participate in and support the financial planning processes by providing timely analysis to commercial leads.
Evaluates cluster and country financial results to ensure optimization of resources – making trade-offs across the business to identify opportunities and ideas for ensuring the appropriate investments for maximized return.
Act as a business partner with commercial business units and leads to support optimal business decisions.
Work collaboratively with Business Support Center and to align and deliver local market finance and business objectives.
Performs special assignments on an ad hoc basis.
Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures and supporting the company mission, values and standards of ethics and integrity.
Skills and Competencies:
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business Administration, Accounting or Finance.
Minimum 5 years of experience in the field of Finance. Preferably working experience in Finance with experience in a multinational company or Pharma background in Financial Planning and Analysis.
Strong business acumen and working knowledge of applications/business processes.
Ability to work in a fast-pace environment and under pressure.
Highly engaged, collaborative and a strong team player.
Strong communication, interpersonal, and organization skills required.
Business-level English skills (speaking and writing) required.
Our Support Functions deliver services and make recommendations about ways to enhance our workplace and the culture of our organization. Our Support Functions include HR, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Procurement, Administration, Facilities and Security.
Who we are …
We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases.
Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.
What we look for …
Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. Are you a passionate B2B marketer with experience in hyper-growth SaaS and mobile businesses? If you are, read on!

Our mission at AppsFlyer is to give digital marketers the very best tools and insights to help them be as successful as they can be. With a highly talented, global team of over 1,500 people, and growing, we're only just getting started.

We're looking for a hungry, passionate, tech-savvy B2B marketer to join our vibrant, friendly office in Herzliya and lead our field marketing programs and customer lifecycle activities in SANI region (South Europe, Africa, Nordics, Israel). You'll be taking a market-leading, mission critical SaaS offering out to digital marketers and brands in the region.

In your B2B toolkit, you'll be highly analytical, independent, a competent storyteller, a first class project manager and have a flair for putting together exceptional events and experiences.

Working closely with your local colleagues in Sales, Customer Success and Partnership Development, as well as a large, cross-functional team of marketing experts in our Global HQ. You'll be responsible for planning, coordinating, executing and reporting all revenue-focused marketing programs for each individual market to deliver new customer leads, existing customer engagement and partnership development goals.

The role reports to the Managing Director of EMEA-SANI, and to the Head of Marketing for those respective markets

This position is temporary for one year

What you'll do:

Events - You're passionate and hands-on about events and will work with Sales, Customer Success, Partnership Development and third party partners, such as trade associations and conference organizers, to create a pipeline of events across all markets that help raise AppsFlyer's brand awareness, position the business as the domain authority for mobile measurement and drive new demand and upsell opportunities.

Content, thought leadership & PR - You enjoy creative copywriting and are responsible for positioning AppsFlyer as the market leader in your local markets. You'll be working closely with the Global Content & Mobile Insights + Comms teams, as well as local PR partners, you'll create thought leadership campaigns to promote AppsFlyer's portfolio or cross-device measurement and fraud protection services. These could be anything from blogs and white papers, to major PR campaigns or event content

Data - You're all about the numbers. As the lead for the individual country growth squads, you'll be responsible for managing ongoing growth initiatives, reporting the results of our time and financial investments and optimizing our activities on an ongoing basis. You'll have the support of our Global Marketing Operations team to do so, as well as numerous BI tools

Team player - You're a go getter and problem solver with a great team spirit. You're happy being part of a close knit team that works hard and plays hard and you're not afraid to roll your sleeves up and do what's right for the team

What you have:

3-5 years of experience in B2B marketing roles ideally within the technology, SaaS or mobile software sectors
Proven track record of planning and executing on field marketing campaigns, generating pipeline and strengthening customer relationships.
Exceptional project management skills, writing, communication, and presentation in English.
Passionate about technology and the latest trends and best practice in B2B marketing

Bonus Points:

A degree in Marketing or related subject area
Experience in CRM and events systems (Salesforce, Splash & Marketo as advantage).
Competitive analysis and account mapping experience - an advantage
Ability to speak an additional relevant language other than English is highly desirable, but not a must have
Knowledge of the E-commerce, gaming or finance mobile marketing world an advantage

As a global company operating from 20 offices worldwide, we reflect the human mosaic of the diverse and multicultural world in which we live. We ensure equal opportunities for all of our employees and promote the recruitment of diverse talents to our global teams without consideration of race, gender, culture, or sexual orientation. We value and encourage curiosity, diversity, and innovation from all our employees, customers, and partners.

"As a Customer Obsessed company, we must first be Employee Obsessed. We need to make sure that we provide the team with the tools and resources they need to go All-In." Oren Kaniel, CEOShow more Report

BlackSwan Technologies is forming a group that will spearhead the delivery of our engagements. We are seeking a group of select few natural leaders, technology savvy, delivery experts, with a passion to disrupt digital transformation. These individuals will own the successful delivery of cutting-edge, highly scalable, mission critical, enterprise software embedded with the future of knowledge technologies, Composite AI, and open source intelligence on top of a cloud agnostic, serverless architecture.

If you are a seasoned professional able to demonstrate strategic thinking, strong work ethics and business results orientation, coupled with strong delivery acumen, excellent communication and negotiation skills, leadership by example, and exceptional problem-solving capabilities, you have found your match.

Responsibilities:

Lead engagements with massive multinational organizations - Be the Technical, Functional and Non-Functional SME and primary point of contact for the client(s) throughout the engagement life-cycle
Become a trusted advisor, by maintaining expert knowledge of the software, and the customer business, with the ability to identify risks, issues, impacts and recommend end-to-end solutioning throughout the engagement lifecycle
Represent the Delivery organization in new engagements scoping, enforcing delivery strategy and planning
Facilitate strategic conversations with clients to identify and explore opportunities, promote synergies and overcome challenges
Facilitate the escalation of critical issues and assist in value-based issues prioritization
Oversee tracking aspects of engagement delivery from inception to BaU, and improve the ways of working, in close collaboration with the Project Manager (which owns the engagement governance)
Oversee and ensure adherence to all QA processes and offer SME acumen during Internal and client acceptance testing and defect triages
Ensure measurable customer satisfaction through successful delivery of defined scope

Requirements:

Bachelor's/Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT, Mathematics, or comparable field preferred
3+ years of experience successfully leading delivery/implementation efforts for enterprise-scale software development products/projects from concept to launch in a delivery/tech-lead role, or similar
4+ years of proven experience with mission critical projects/programs in a software/platform architect/devops/engineering/similar role, with highly advanced technical knowledge in assigned specialism
2+ years In depth cloud experience with AWS, Azure and/or GCP
Functional knowledge of programming/scripting languages, such as JavaScript, PowerShell, Python, Bash, SQL, .NET, Java, PHP, Ruby, PERL, C++, R, etc. Hands on experience with Gremlin, SPARQL and GraphQL is highly desirable
Ability to learn new technologies fast, work independently and multi-task to meet deadlines
Proven Agile experience using Jira, Confluence
Business knowledge of Finance, Compliance, Health Domains is highly desirable
People who speak their mind

We Appreciate Those Who Have:

Excellent understanding of large enterprises, in particular Financial Institutions, their ecosystem, constraints, and business drivers
People leadership, good interpersonal skills and ability to influence senior stakeholders, internal and external, through trustworthiness, comprehensive communication and diplomacy skills
Experience of working with multi-disciplinary teams and ability to manage and lead outside of reporting lines
Strong Technical knowledge and experience in delivering software / platform engineering solutions, providing extensive technical advice and managing user requirements and process and standards maintenance
Strong work ethics, service mindset and, excellent people skills
Desire to proactively drive change in a fast-paced environment
Desire to solve a problem once so it will never repeat
Ability to simplify complex issues communication to stakeholders but go into the finest details when working with the team
Strong understanding of version control systems (Git / codecommit) and application lifecycle management
Highly proficient with IaC and Configuration Management tooling (Terraform, Ansible, Puppet, Chef)
Strong understanding of CI/CD pipelines
Experience working with Kubernetes, microservice architectures
Experience with ECS, Fargate, S3, RDS

We Offer:

A high-impact and high-profile role in an incredibly fast-paced growth environment
Possibility to master cutting edge technologies, AI, deep learning, NLP, Serverless, Cloud Native, and more
Opportunity to lead multinational teams in engagements with some of the worlds largest global enterprises
A competitive remuneration package
Stable work based on employment contract
Flexible and remote friendly working environment

Who We Are:

BlackSwan Technologies is reinventing enterprise software through Agile Intelligence for the Enterprise – a fusion of data, artificial intelligence, and cloud technologies that provides unparalleled business value. Our multi-tiered enterprise offerings include the award-winning platform-as-a-service, ELEMENT™, which enables organizations to build enterprise AI applications at scale, for any domain, quickly and at a fraction of the cost of alternatives. BlackSwan and its global partners also provide industry-proven applications that are ready-made and fully customisable for rapid ROI. These offerings are generating billions of dollars in economic value through digital transformation at renowned global brands. The private company maintains gravity centers in the UK, Germany, Poland, Israel, the US, and Sri Lanka.

www.blackswantechnologies.ai

Equal Opportunities:

At BlackSwan Technologies, we prioritize diversity. We celebrate difference and embed it into every aspect of our workplace, from our community to our product. BlackSwan Technologies is proud and committed to providing equal opportunity employment to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, citizenship, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. 500Affiliates is one of the most well-known affiliation programs in the fintech area.
With more than thousands of registered affiliates, we keep on growing, strengthening our relationship with our partners, and penetrating new markets.
We are looking for a new affiliate manager who is passionate about online marketing and ready to build long-term relationships with some of the most well-known publishers. This person will join our top team and take part in our current team efforts and growth areas.
What you will do?
Expand our affiliation program by searching for new partners and identifying new opportunities worldwide
Upscale the current efforts - Collaborate with different teams to build and uplift the activity with our partners in order to achieve the main goals
Conduct various campaigns and working methods to improve profitability
Proactively track, report, analyze, and optimize the performance of the partnerships, including identifying issues as they arise, assessing possible solutions, and executing them
Managing financial activities, responsible for monthly payments, fraud detection, and special deals
Working closely with the compliance teams to ensure the affiliates' activity complies with our guidelines
Exhibit and represent the 500Affiliates program in conferences and in-person meetings with affiliates
Requirements:

B.A / B.S.c degree
Proven experience in managing sales-related partnerships/user acquisition
Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills
Strong analytical skills
Fluency in English (additional languages is an advantage)
Passionate about finance and online marketing - an advantage
Self-starter and independent. Ability to take an entire project from A to Z
A people person and a team playerShow more Report

Description: A rapidly growing fintech company that provides technology infrastructure powering the future of financial services. Leveraging our proprietary real-time banking core, we deliver innovative and scalable embedded payments, cards, lending and crypto solutions to millions of consumers and businesses. We are backed by leading investors and serve the world’s most essential fintech and technology companies. Together with our partners, we are reshaping global finance and financial inclusion.

While our company is based in the United States, a majority of development activity is based in Israel. Our main office is in Har Hotzvim, Jerusalem, but our development teams work almost exclusively from home.
